item.title: Graph Signal Processing (GSP)
item.author: merturk
item.description:
Graph Signal Processing (GSP) is a mathematical framework that extends discrete signal processing (DSP) tools such as filtering and signal decomposition to graph data structures.

Graph Signal Processing is suitable for scenarios where data donâ€™t have a regular pattern or cannot be represented as time series signals. In such scenarios, modeling through graph structures can exploit signal-processing tasks on complex structures through GSP.

GSP can be applied to network structures such as sensor, social, and biological networks. As well as image processing.
